title: Diorama
subtitle: A Docker-based distributed algorithm simulator
descriptionParagraphs: My master's degree final year project. A browser-based simulator designed for use by lecturers to demonstrate the behaviour of distributed algorithms, and for students to write and test distributed algorithm implementations.
Users can write algorithms in their choice of a range of available languages; define a network topology which can include automatically-generated nodes and the simulate this distributed network.
You can read the report submitted for this final year project here.

title: Linguist Aid
subtitle: Initiative to connect multi-ligual volunteers to aid groups
descriptionParagraphs: During the UK's COVID-19 outbreak in 2020, I set up a website with a few friends to connect volunteers with mutual aid groups and charities around the country to help with tasks like interpreting materials, interpreting for vulnerable people, and chatting to isolated people who speak little to no English.
This initiative was featured on the website of Team London, the Mayor of London's volunteering programme.
